steps.title: Taking Care of your PICC line

substeps.title: Before Using Your PICC Line
substeps.description:
• Check that the green clamps on the extension tubing are open.
• Try to flush with saline (NaCl) — it should go in easily.
• Do NOT force it if there is a complete blockage.
• Try to get a blood return by gently pulling back with a syringe.
• If you can't get blood back, flush with 20ml saline before and after giving antibiotics.

substeps.title: Daily Check
substeps.description:
• Look at and gently feel the skin around your PICC line.
• Watch for redness, swelling, pain, or warmth around the area. Contact your healthcare provider right away if you notice any of these signs

substeps.title: Dressing Changes and Check-ups
substeps.description: Your PICC line will be checked and re-dressed at each clinic visit—at least once a week, or sooner if the dressing comes loose.

substeps.title: Showering
substeps.description: Cover your PICC line with plastic to keep it dry while showering. If any moisture gets under the plastic, the dressing must be changed. Moisture creates a perfect place for bacteria to grow.

substeps.title: WARNING
substeps.description: Do NOT take baths or use saunas.

substeps.title: Used Syringes with Blood
substeps.description: Place any syringes that have blood in them into a plastic bag. Bring them with you to your next dressing change
